TITLE: Inflation: Is The Glass Half Empty Or Half Full?
SUMMARY: The inflation rate rose 0.2% in April; is the glass half empty or half full? Today the BEA (Bureau of Economic Analysis) released the PCE (personal consumption expenditures) for April 2022. This report is the preferred inflation gauge used by the Federal Reserve as a key component to shape their forward guidance of monetary policy. […]

TITLE: Stocks Rise On Slowing Inflation Report
SUMMARY: The Fed's preferred inflation gauge's core personal consumption expenditures price index rose 4.9% from a year ago in April, in line with estimates and a deceleration from March when the inflation gauge stood at 5.2%. While still elevated, the report indicates that price pressures could be easing a bit, as reported by the Commerce Department […]
